t: Hear*pn a just cause, O Lord,*s give heed to my cry; Give*ln ear to my prayer, which is not from deceitful lips.
Let*ln my judgment come forth from Your presence; Let*ln Your eyes look with equity.
You*ln have tried my heart; You*ln have visited me*i by night; You*ln have tested me and You find nothing; I*ln have purposed that my mouth will not transgress.
As*ln for the deeds of men, by the word of Your lips I*ln have kept from the paths of the violent.
My*ln steps have held fast to Your paths. My*ln feet have not slipped.
I*ln have called upon You, for You will answer me, O God; Incline*ln Your ear to me, hear my speech.
Wondrously*ln show Your lovingkindness, O*ln Savior of those who take refuge at Your right hand From*ln those who rise up against*i them.*i
Keep*ln me as the apple of the eye; Hide*ln me in the shadow of Your wings
From*ln the wicked who despoil me, My*ln deadly enemies who surround me.
They*ln have closed their unfeeling heart,*i With*ln their mouth they speak proudly.
They*ln have now surrounded us in our steps; They*ln set their eyes to cast us*i down to the ground.
He*ln is like a lion that is eager to tear, And*ln as a young lion lurking in hiding places.
Arise,*ln O Lord,*s confront him, bring him low; Deliver*ln my soul from the wicked with Your sword,

From*ln men with Your hand, O Lord,*s From*ln men of the world, whose portion is in this*i life, And*ln whose belly You fill with Your treasure; They*ln are satisfied with children, And*ln leave their abundance to their babes.
As*ln for me, I shall behold Your face in righteousness; I*ln will be satisfied with Your likeness when I awake.
